      • getTriples

        public static Collection<org.apache.jena.graph.Triple> getTriples(InputStream input,
                                                                  String lang)
        Extract a collection of triples from an RDF input stream. The encoding of the incoming RDF is specified by 'lang' (e.g. "RDF/XML"). The possible values for 'lang' are the same as for Jena's 'Model.read' method: "RDF/XML", "N-TRIPLES", and "N3". The main caveat of this method is that it must load the entire set of triples into memory.
        Parameters:
        input - The RDF to be converted to triples.
        lang - The encoding of the RDF.
        Returns:
        a collection of triples.

      • getPlainString

        public static String getPlainString(org.apache.jena.graph.Node node)
        Return the string representation of a Jena Node, without surrounding brackets or quotes, and without any xsd:datatype suffix. The default string representation of a node in Jena quotes literals (including numbers) and appends the associated xsd:datatype. However, Jena does not include angle brackets around the absolute datatype URI, so the default string form will not parse within a standard SPARQL query. Also, the Jena string representation of a variable doesn't include the preceding "?".
        Parameters:
        node -
        Returns:

      • getPlainString

        public static String getPlainString(org.apache.jena.rdf.model.RDFNode node)

      • getBoolean

        public static Boolean getBoolean(org.apache.jena.rdf.model.Literal literal)
        Attempt to parse the specified literal as a boolean. In addition to the actual typed literal true, the strings "true", "t", "on", "1", etc., will be parsed as true.
        Parameters:
        literal -
        Returns:

      • createModelFromPathOrURL

        public static org.apache.jena.rdf.model.Model createModelFromPathOrURL(String pathOrURL)
                                                                throws IOException
        Deprecated. use loadModelFromString (and create/destroy your own model)
        Create a new memory model and read the contents of the argument, which can be either a local path or a remote URL.
        Parameters:
        pathOrURL - a local path or a remote URL
        Returns:
        the new model
        Throws:
        IOException - if the argument is an invalid URL and can't be read locally

                                                                  String s)

        Load the specified model according to the argument, which can be a remote URL, a local path, or inline RDF. FIXME use ContextClassLoader to check classpath.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the new model
        Throws:
        IOException - if the argument is invalid

      • loadModelFromString

                                                                  Class<?> c)
                                                           throws IOException
        Load the specified model according to the argument, which can be a remote URL, a local path, or inline RDF.
        Parameters:
        s - a remote URL, a local path, or inline RDF
        c - a class relative to which to search for a resource, or null
        Returns:
        the new model
        Throws:
